subject: Personal Finance
title: Regret Aversion
description: A quick win: understand Regret Aversion.

hook.text: You almost bought Amazon stock in 2001. That near-miss haunts you more than a stock you never considered.

buildup.text: Regret aversion makes us avoid decisions that might lead to future regret.

discovery.text: Investors often hold cash instead of investing because a loss from action hurts more than a missed gain.

twist.text: The fear of regret makes people follow the herd. If everyone else loses, it feels less painful.

climax.text: Regret over inaction compounds silently. Decades of not investing cost far more than a single bad trade.

punchline.text: The biggest regrets are usually inaction.

quiz.question: What is regret aversion?
options: Avoiding decisions that might cause future regret
